member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetEvent
member.summary: Reports a debugger event

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetStarted
member.summary: Raised when the debugger resumes execution after being stopped

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetReady
member.summary: Raised when the underlying debugging engine has been initialized and it is ready to start execution.

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetStopped
member.summary: Raised when the debugging session is paused

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetInterrupted
member.summary: Raised when the execution is interrupted by an external event

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetHitBreakpoint
member.summary: Raised when a breakpoint is hit

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetSignaled
member.summary: Raised when the execution is interrupted due to receiving a signal

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetExited
member.summary: Raised when the debugged process exits

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetExceptionThrown
member.summary: Raised when an exception for which there is a catchpoint is thrown

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetUnhandledException
member.summary: Raised when an exception is unhandled

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetThreadStarted
member.summary: Raised when a thread is started in the debugged process

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TargetThreadStopped
member.summary: Raised when a thread is stopped in the debugged process

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.BusyStateChanged
member.summary: Raised when the 'busy state' of the debugger changes. The debugger may switch to busy state if it is in the middle of an expression evaluation which can't be aborted.

member.name: E:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.AssemblyLoaded
member.summary: Raised when an assembly is loaded

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resource used by the object.
member.remarks: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.ExceptionHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets an exception handler to be invoked when an exception is raised by the debugger engine.
member.remarks: Notice that this handler will be used to report exceptions in the debugger, not exceptions raised in the debugged process.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.ConnectionDialogCreator
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection dialog creator callback.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.ConnectionDialogCreatorExtended
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection dialog creator callback.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.BreakpointTraceHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the breakpoint trace handler.
member.remarks: This handler is invoked when the value of a tracepoint has to be printed

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.TypeResolverHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the type resolver handler.
member.remarks: This handler is invoked when the expression evaluator needs to resolve a type name.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.GetExpressionEvaluator
member.summary: Gets or sets the an expression evaluator provider
member.remarks: This handler is invoked when the debugger needs to get an evaluator for a specific type of file

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.CustomBreakEventHitHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom break event hit handler.
member.remarks: This handler is invoked when a custom breakpoint is hit to determine if the debug session should continue or stop.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.Breakpoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the breakpoint store for the debugger session.

member.summary: Starts a debugging session
member.exception: Is thrown when an argument passed to a method is invalid because it is .

member.summary: Starts a debugging session by attaching the debugger to a running process
member.exception: Is thrown when an argument passed to a method is invalid because it is .

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.Detach
member.summary: Detaches this debugging session from the debugged process

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.AttachedToProcess
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this has been attached to a process using the Attach method.
member.value: true if attached to process; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.ActiveThread
member.summary: Gets or sets the active thread.
member.remarks: This property can only be used when the debugger is paused

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.NextLine
member.summary: Executes one line of code

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.StepLine
member.summary: Executes one line of code, stepping into method invocations

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.NextInstruction
member.summary: Executes one low level instruction

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.StepInstruction
member.summary: Executes one low level instruction, stepping into method invocations

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.Finish
member.summary: Resumes the execution of the debugger and stops when the current method is exited

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.SetNextStatement(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the next statement on the active thread.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.SetNextStatement(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the next statement on the active thread.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.GetBreakEventStatus(Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent)

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.GetBreakEventStatusMessage(Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent)
member.summary: Returns a status message of a breakpoint for this debugger session.

member.summary: Gets the debugger options object

member.summary: Gets or sets the evaluation options.

member.summary: Resumes the execution of the debugger

member.summary: Pauses the execution of the debugger

member.summary: Stops the execution of the debugger by killing the debugged process

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the debuggee is currently connected

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.HasExited
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the debuggee has exited.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.GetProcesses
member.summary: Gets a list of all processes

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OutputWriter
member.summary: Gets or sets the output writer callback.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.LogWriter

member.remarks: This callback is invoked to print debugger log messages

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.DebugWriter

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.DisassembleFile(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the disassembly of a source code file
member.returns: An array of AssemblyLine, with one element for each source code line that could be disassembled
member.remarks: This method can only be used when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.CancelAsyncEvaluations
member.summary: Stops the execution of background evaluations being done by the debugger
member.remarks: This method can only be used when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.CanCancelAsyncEvaluations
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there are background evaluations being done by the debugger which can be cancelled.
member.remarks: This method can only be used when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnCancelAsyncEvaluations
member.summary: Override to stop the execution of background evaluations being done by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnResolveExpression(System.String,Mono.Debugging.Client.SourceLocation)
member.summary: Called when an expression needs to be resolved

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.BindSourceFileBreakpoints(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to bind all unbound breakpoints of a source file
member.remarks: This method can be called by a subclass to ask the debugger session to attempt to bind all unbound breakpoints defined on the given file. This method could be called, for example, when a new assembly that contains this file is loaded into memory. It is not necessary to use this method if the subclass keeps track of unbound breakpoints by itself.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.UnbindSourceFileBreakpoints(System.String)
member.summary: Unbinds all bound breakpoints of a source file
member.remarks: This method can be called by a subclass to ask the debugger session to unbind all bound breakpoints defined on the given file. This method could be called, for example, when an assembly that contains this file is unloaded from memory. It is not necessary to use this method if the subclass keeps track of unbound breakpoints by itself.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.HandleException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Reports an unhandled exception in the debugger
member.returns: True if the debugger engine handles the exception. False otherwise.
member.remarks: This method can be used by subclasses to report errors in the debugger that must be reported to the user.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.UseOperationThread
member.summary: When set, operations such as OnRun, OnAttachToProcess, OnStepLine, etc, are run in a background thread, so it will not block the caller of the corresponding public methods.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnRun(Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerStartInfo)
member.summary: Called to start the execution of the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnAttachToProcess(System.Int64)
member.summary: Called to attach the debugger to a running process

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnAttachToProcess(Mono.Debugging.Client.ProcessInfo)
member.summary: Called to attach the debugger to a running process

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnDetach
member.summary: Called to detach the debugging session from the running process

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnSetActiveThread(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Called when the active thread has to be changed
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnStop
member.summary: Called when the debug session has to be paused

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnExit
member.summary: Called when the target process has to be exited

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnStepLine
member.summary: Called to step one source code line
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnNextLine
member.summary: Called to step one source line, but step over method calls
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnStepInstruction
member.summary: Called to step one instruction
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnNextInstruction
member.summary: Called to step one instruction, but step over method calls
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnFinish
member.summary: Called to continue execution until leaving the current method
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnContinue
member.summary: Called to resume execution
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.CanSetNextStatement
member.summary: Checks whether or not the debugger supports setting the next statement to use when the debugger is resumed.
member.remarks: This method is generally used to determine whether or not UI menu items should be shown.
member.value: true if the debugger supports setting the next statement to use when the debugger is resumed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnSetNextStatement(System.Int64,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the next statement to be executed when the debugger is resumed.
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnSetNextStatement(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the next statement to be executed when the debugger is resumed.
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnInsertBreakEvent(Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent)
member.summary: Called to insert a new breakpoint or catchpoint
member.remarks: Implementations of this method must: (1) create (and return) an instance of BreakEventInfo (or a subclass of it). (2) Attempt to activate a breakpoint at the location specified in breakEvent. If the breakpoint cannot be activated at the time this method is called, it is the responsibility of the DebuggerSession subclass to attempt it later on. The BreakEventInfo object can be used to change the status of the breakpoint, update the hit point, etc.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnRemoveBreakEvent(Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo)
member.summary: Called when a breakpoint has been removed.
member.remarks: Implementations of this method should remove or disable the breakpoint in the debugging engine.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnUpdateBreakEvent(Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo)
member.summary: Called when information about a breakpoint has changed
member.remarks: This method is called when some information about the breakpoint changes. Notice that the file and line of a breakpoint or the exception name of a catchpoint can't be modified. Changes of the Enabled property are notified by calling OnEnableBreakEvent.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnEnableBreakEvent(Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when a break event is enabled or disabled

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.AllowBreakEventChanges
member.summary: Queried when the debugger session has to check if changes in breakpoints are allowed or not
member.value: true if break event changes are allowed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property should return false if at the time it is invoked the debugger engine doesn't support adding, removing or doing changes in breakpoints.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnGetThreads(System.Int64)
member.summary: Called to get a list of the threads of a process
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnGetProcesses
member.summary: Called to get a list of all debugee processes
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.summary: Called to get the backtrace of a thread
member.remarks: This method can only be called when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.summary: Called to gets the disassembly of a source code file
member.returns: An array of AssemblyLine, with one element for each source code line that could be disassembled
member.remarks: This method can only be used when the debuggee is stopped by the debugger

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.OnWrapDebuggerObject``1(``0)
member.summary: Called for every object that is obtained from the debugger engine. Subclasses may want to create wrappers for some of those objects

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession.FetchFrames(Mono.Debugging.Client.ThreadInfo[])
member.summary: Calling this method is optional. It's usefull to call this method so underlying debugger can optimize speed of fetching multiple frames on .
member.param: Array of threads to fetch frames.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.StackFrame.FullStackframeText
member.summary: Gets the full name of the stackframe. Which respects Session.EvaluationOptions.StackFrameFormat

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.StackFrame.ValidateExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Returns True if the expression is valid and can be evaluated for this frame.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.StackFrame.ValidateExpression(System.String,Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Returns True if the expression is valid and can be evaluated for this frame.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.Flags
member.summary: Gets the flags of the value

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.Name
member.summary: Name of the value (for example, the property name)

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the object
member.exception: Is thrown when trying to set a value on a read-only ObjectValue
member.remarks: This value is a string representation of the ObjectValue. The content depends on several evaluation options. For example, if ToString calls are enabled, this value will be the result of calling ToString. If the object is a primitive type, in general the Value will be an expression that represents the value in the target language. For example, when debugging C#, if the property is an string, the value will include the quotation marks and chars like '\' will be properly escaped. If you need to get the real CLR value of the object, use GetRawValue.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.DisplayValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the display value of this object
member.remarks: This method returns a string to be used when showing the value of this object. In most cases, the Value and DisplayValue properties return the same text, but there are some cases in which DisplayValue may return a more convenient textual representation of the value, which may not be a valid target language expression. For example in C#, an enum Value includes the full enum type name (e.g. "Gtk.ResponseType.OK"), while DisplayValue only has the enum value name ("OK").

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.SetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of this object, using the default evaluation options

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.SetValue(System.String,Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Sets the value of this object, using the specified evaluation options
member.exception: Is thrown if the value is read-only

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetRawValue
member.summary: Gets the raw value of this object
member.remarks: This method can be used to get the CLR value of the object. For example, if this ObjectValue is a property of type String, this method will return the System.String value of the property. If this ObjectValue refers to an object instead of a primitive value, then a RawValue object will be returned. RawValue can be used to get and set members of an object, and to call methods. If this ObjectValue refers to an array, then a RawValueArray object will be returned.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetRawValue(Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Gets the raw value of this object
member.remarks: This method can be used to get the CLR value of the object. For example, if this ObjectValue is a property of type String, this method will return the System.String value of the property. If this ObjectValue refers to an object instead of a primitive value, then a RawValue object will be returned. RawValue can be used to get and set members of an object, and to call methods. If this ObjectValue refers to an array, then a RawValueArray object will be returned.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.SetRawValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the raw value of this object
member.remarks: The provided value can be a primitive type, a RawValue object or a RawValueArray object.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.SetRawValue(System.Object,Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Sets the raw value of this object
member.remarks: The provided value can be a primitive type, a RawValue object or a RawValueArray object.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.TypeName
member.summary: Full name of the type of the object

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.ChildSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets the child selector.
member.remarks: The child selector is an expression which can be concatenated to a parent expression to get this child. For example, if this object is a reference to a field named 'foo' of an object, the child selector is '.foo'.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.HasChildren
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this object has children.
member.value: true if this instance has children; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetChild(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a child value
member.remarks: This method can be used to get a member of an object (such as a field or property)

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetChild(System.String,Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Gets a child value
member.param: Options to be used to evaluate the child
member.remarks: This method can be used to get a member of an object (such as a field or property)

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetAllChildren
member.summary: Gets all children of the object
member.returns: An array of all child values

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetAllChildren(Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Gets all children of the object
member.returns: An array of all child values
member.param: Options to be used to evaluate the children

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetArrayItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an item of an array
member.exception: Is thrown if this object is not an array (IsArray returns false)

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.GetArrayItem(System.Int32,Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Gets an item of an array
member.param: Options to be used to evaluate the item
member.exception: Is thrown if this object is not an array (IsArray returns false)

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.ArrayCount
member.summary: Gets the number of items of an array
member.exception: Is thrown if this object is not an array (IsArray returns false)

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the value of this object
member.remarks: This method can be called to get a more up-to-date value for this object.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.Refresh(Mono.Debugging.Client.EvaluationOptions)
member.summary: Refreshes the value of this object
member.remarks: This method can be called to get a more up-to-date value for this object.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue.WaitHandle
member.summary: Gets a wait handle which can be used to wait for the evaluation of this object to end

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is enabled.
member.remarks: Changes in this property are automatically applied. There is no need to call CommitChanges().

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.GetStatus(Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession)
member.summary: Gets the status of the break event
member.returns: The status of the break event for the given debug session
member.param: Session for which to get the status of the break event

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.GetStatusMessage(Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerSession)
member.summary: Gets a message describing the status of the break event
member.returns: The status message of the break event for the given debug session
member.param: Session for which to get the status message of the break event

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.TraceExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression to be traced when the breakpoint is hit
member.remarks: If this break event is hit and the HitAction is TraceExpression, the debugger will evaluate and print the value of this property. The CommitChanges() method has to be called for changes in this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.LastTraceValue
member.summary: Gets the last value traced.
member.remarks: This property returns the last evaluation of TraceExpression.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.HitAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to be performed when the breakpoint is hit
member.remarks: If the value is Break, the debugger will pause the execution. If the value is PrintExpression, the debugger will evaluate and print the value of the TraceExpression property. If the value is CustomAction, the debugger will execute the CustomBreakEventHitHandler callback specified in DebuggerSession, and will provide the value of CustomActionId as argument. The CommitChanges() method has to be called for changes in this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.HitCountMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the hit count mode.
member.remarks: When the break event is hit, the HitCountMode is used to compare the CurrentHitCount with the TargetHitCount to determine if the break event should trigger.

members.member:
Gets or sets the target hit count.
When the break event is hit, if the value of HitCountMode is not None, then the value of CurrentHitCount will be incremented. Execution will immediately resume if it is determined that the CurrentHitCount vs TargetHitCount comparison does not meet the requirements of HitCountMode.
The CommitChanges() method has to be called for changes in this property to take effect.
FIXME: rename this to TargetHitCount

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.CurrentHitCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the current hit count.
member.remarks: When the break event is hit, the HitCountMode is used to compare the CurrentHitCount with the TargetHitCount to determine if the break event should trigger.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.CustomActionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom action identifier.
member.remarks: If this break event is hit and the value of HitAction is CustomAction, the debugger will execute the CustomBreakEventHitHandler callback specified in DebuggerSession, and will provide the value of this property as argument. The CommitChanges() method has to be called for changes in this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.NonUserBreakpoint
member.summary: NonUserBreakpoint is special kind of breakpoint that is not placed by user but by IDE/Add-In. This breakpoint is usually used by AddIn to execute code on debugee at certain point in application execution. IDE must hide this breakpoint from user. In breakpoints list and it must not stop execution(show breakpoint hit location). WARNING: Code that adds this breakpoint must also make sure to call session.Continue(); when breakpoint is hit.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.CommitChanges
member.summary: Commits changes done in the break event properties
member.remarks: This method must be called after doing changes in the break event properties.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.Clone
member.summary: Clone this instance.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent.CopyFrom(Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEvent)
member.summary: Makes a copy of this instance
member.param: A break event from which to copy the data.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.StackFrameFormat.ExternalCode
member.summary: Default is null. Which means do same as "ProjectAssembliesOnly" setting.

member.name: T:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValue
member.summary: Represents an object in the process being debugged

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValue.#ctor(Mono.Debugging.Backend.IRawValue)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValue.TypeName
member.summary: Full name of the type of the object

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValue.CallMethod(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes a method on the object
member.param: The parameters (primitive type values, RawValue instances or RawValueArray instances)

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValue.GetMemberValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a field or property
member.returns: The value (a primitive type value, a RawValue instance or a RawValueArray instance)
member.param: Name of the field or property

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValue.SetMemberValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value of a field or property
member.param: Name of the field or property
The value (a primitive type value, a RawValue instance or a RawValueArray instance)

member.name: T:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueArray
member.summary: Represents an array of objects in the process being debugged

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueArray.#ctor(Mono.Debugging.Backend.IRawValueArray)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueArray.ElementTypeName
member.summary: Full type name of the array items

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueArray.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the item at the specified index.
member.remarks: The item value can be a primitive type value, a RawValue instance or a RawValueArray instance.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueArray.GetValues(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the values.
member.param: The number of items to get.
member.remarks: This method is useful for incrementally fetching an array in order to avoid long waiting periods when the array is too large for ToArray().

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueArray.ToArray
member.summary: Returns an array with all items of the RawValueArray
member.remarks: This method is useful to avoid unnecessary debugger-debuggee roundtrips when processing all items of an array. For example, if a RawValueArray represents an image encoded in a byte[], getting the values one by one using the indexer is very slow. The ToArray() will return the whole byte[] in a single call.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueArray.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the array

member.name: T:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueString
member.summary: Represents a string object in the process being debugged

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueString.#ctor(Mono.Debugging.Backend.IRawValueString)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueString.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the string

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueString.Substring(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a substring of the string
member.param: The starting index of the requested substring.
The length of the requested substring.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.RawValueString.Value
member.summary: Gets the value.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ExceptionInfo.#ctor(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: The provided value can have the following members: Type of the object: type of the exception Message: Message of the exception Instance: Raw instance of the exception StackTrace: an array of frames. Each frame must have: Value of the object: display text of the frame File: name of the file Line: line Column: column InnerException: inner exception, following the same format described above.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ExceptionStackFrame.#ctor(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: The provided value must have a specific structure. The Value property is the display text. A child "File" member must be the name of the file. A child "Line" member must be the line. A child "Column" member must be the column.

member.name: F:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventStatus.Disconnected
member.summary: The breakpoint is not connected to any debug session

member.name: F:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventStatus.NotBound
member.summary: The breakpoint is not yet bound to a valid location

member.name: F:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventStatus.Bound
member.summary: The breakpoint is bound

member.name: F:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventStatus.Invalid
member.summary: The breakpoint could not be bound because the breakpoint location is invalid

member.name: F:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventStatus.BindError
member.summary: There was a debugger error while binding the breakpoint

member.name: T:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo
member.summary: This class can be used to manage and get information about a breakpoint at debug-time. It is intended to be used by DebuggerSession subclasses.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo.Handle
member.summary: Gets or sets the implementation specific handle of the breakpoint

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo.BreakEvent
member.summary: Break event that this instance represents

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo.Status
member.summary: Gets the status of the break event

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo.StatusMessage
member.summary: Gets a description of the status

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo.AdjustBreakpointLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts the location of a breakpoint
member.remarks: This method can be used to temporarily change source code line of the breakpoint. This is useful, for example, when two adjacent lines are mapped to a single native offset. If the breakpoint is set to the first of those lines, the debugger might end stopping in the second line, because it has the same native offset. To avoid this confusion situation, the debugger implementation may decide to adjust the position of the breakpoint, and move it to the second line. This line adjustment has effect only during the debug session, and is automatically reset when it terminates.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Client.BreakEventInfo.HitCountReached
member.summary: Increments the hit count.
member.returns: true if the break event should trigger, or false otherwise.

member.name: T:Mono.Debugging.Client.DebuggerLoggingService
member.summary: This is a simple abstraction so that MD can plug in its own logging service to handle the Mono.Debugging.Soft error logging, without Mono.Debugging.Soft depending on MonoDevelop.Core. In the absence of a custom logger, it writes to Console.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Client.ICustomLogger.GetNewDebuggerLogFilename
member.summary: Gets the new debugger log filename. It may return null which means disable logging.
member.returns: The new debugger log filename or null.

member.name: T:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.AsyncEvaluationTracker
member.summary: This class can be used to generate an ObjectValue using a provided evaluation delegate. The value is initialy evaluated synchronously (blocking the caller). If no result is obtained after a short period (provided in the WaitTime property), evaluation will then be made asynchronous and the Run method will immediately return an ObjectValue with the Evaluating state.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.AsyncOperation.ExceptionMessage
member.summary: Message of the exception, if the execution failed.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.AsyncOperation.Description
member.summary: Returns a short description of the operation, to be shown in the Debugger Busy Dialog when it blocks the execution of the debugger.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.AsyncOperation.Invoke
member.summary: Called to invoke the operation. The execution must be asynchronous (it must return immediatelly).

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.AsyncOperation.Abort
member.summary: Called to abort the execution of the operation. It has to throw an exception if the operation can't be aborted. This operation must not block. The engine will wait for the operation to be aborted by calling WaitForCompleted.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.AsyncOperation.WaitForCompleted(System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits until the operation has been completed or aborted.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.AsyncOperation.Shutdown
member.summary: Called when the debugging session has been disposed. I must cause any call to WaitForCompleted to exit, even if the operation has not been completed or can't be aborted.

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.ObjectValueAdaptor.GetMembers(Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.EvaluationContext,System.Object,System.Object,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary: Returns all members of a type. The following binding flags have to be honored: BindingFlags.Static, BindingFlags.Instance, BindingFlags.Public, BindingFlags.NonPublic, BindingFlags.DeclareOnly

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.ObjectValueAdaptor.GetMembers(Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.EvaluationContext,Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.IObjectSource,System.Object,System.Object,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary: Returns all members of a type. The following binding flags have to be honored: BindingFlags.Static, BindingFlags.Instance, BindingFlags.Public, BindingFlags.NonPublic, BindingFlags.DeclareOnly

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.ObjectValueNameTracker.Disambiguate(Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.ValueReference,Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Disambiguate the ObjectValue's name (in the case where the property name also exists in a base class).

member.name: M:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.TimedEvaluator.Run(Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.EvaluatorDelegate,Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.EvaluatorDelegate)
member.summary: Executes the provided evaluator. If a result is obtained before RunTimeout milliseconds, the method ends returning True. If it does not finish after RunTimeout milliseconds, the method ends retuning False, although the evaluation continues in the background. In that case, when evaluation ends, the provided delayedDoneCallback delegate is called.

member.name: P:Mono.Debugging.Evaluation.EvaluationTimer.Success
member.summary: Indicates if the evaluation was successful. If this is false the timing will not be reported and a failure will be indicated.
